Participants.evidence: Patients with T1â€“2 breast cancer and no more than two metastatic sentinel lymph nodes undergoing mastectomy were analysed.

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either axillary lymph node dissection followed by adjuvant treatment (standard arm) or adjuvant treatment alone (experimental arm).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was overall survival.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 111 were randomly assigned to the axillary lymph node dissection group and 107 to the sentinel lymph node biopsy-only group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 218 patients were treated with mastectomy

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 5-year overall survival rates were 97.8 and 98.7 per cent in the axillary lymph node dissection treatment arm and the sentinel lymph node biopsy-only treatment arm, respectively ( P = 0.597).
